headline: President Trump cautiously optimistic about North Korea
subHeadline: Kim Jong Un signals he is willing to denuclearize North Korea if the U.S. agrees to talks; reaction and analysis on 'The Five.'

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: MSNBC called this whole thing historic, but for everyone else it felt kind of sad and odd. It reminds me of the footage we ran when someone freaks on an airplane flight. We air because it's so much fun to watch. Or when someone loses their temper in a store and shouting at a clerk, we air that tape because it's so much fun to watch. Just like high school, when a fight breaks out, we all crowd around to watch because it's so much fun. Thanks to the plethora of cameras, the person among 300 million having a really bad day becomes a delightful segment. And it's obvious here. When it comes to news, we've lost perspective. In overdrive, to fill the daily recommended allowance of anti-Trumpism, everything becomes a banner headline including some poor guy acting manic of air either caused by drugs side effect, booze, or Roger Stone advice. Hard to tell the difference at times. if (window && window.foxstrike && Array.isArray(window.foxstrike.cmd)) { window.foxstrike.cmd.push(function(Strike) { Strike.insertAd('desktop', 'lb16', 'desktop-desk-ad-lb16', ''); }); } else { console.error('Error: window.foxstrike not found'); } One newscaster accuses Nunberg of drinking just there. Well, if you smelled the booze on him, why did you have him on? Where the optics just too good or was it because he knew the guy was going to dump all over Trump? The bottom line: we all love a good meltdown, real or contrived, until it's us doing the melting down. Then we hope to God there isn't a camera nearby because if there is, all compassion goes out the window. Dana, it's hard to tell -- is this a publicity stunt or was he really messed up? Was this a Roger Stone production?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Well, I know that he's always been a big admirer of Roger Stone, something like a prank and something outrageous. I don't know. I've never met Sam. I think that once you see somebody do an interview with one reporter and then basically dialing around to find out who else will have me tonight.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yeah. if (window && window.foxstrike && Array.isArray(window.foxstrike.cmd)) { window.foxstrike.cmd.push(function(Strike) { Strike.insertAd('desktop', 'lb17', 'desktop-desk-ad-lb17', ''); }); } else { console.error('Error: window.foxstrike not found'); }

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yeah.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yeah, that's a good point. Thank God nobody asked me if I was drinking on the show.

utterances.sentences: Oh, my goodness. Kimberly.

utterances.speaker: PERINO

It's your favorite subject about how everybody -- New Year's Eve, it's like drinking. if (window && window.foxstrike && Array.isArray(window.foxstrike.cmd)) { window.foxstrike.cmd.push(function(Strike) { Strike.insertAd('desktop', 'lb19', 'desktop-desk-ad-lb19', ''); }); } else { console.error('Error: window.foxstrike not found'); }

utterances.sentences: I'm telling you I'm full of them, full of great points. So that I thought was ironic. Correct. And also, I think that the fact that she would do that -- I think it's unseemly. Why would you do that? You know, it seems almost like politics, of personal destruction. You had the guy on there. He's agreed to come on your show. Like, who are you trying to send judgement -- or examine him.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Like intervention.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: . recognition expert. Or you're like pulling him over on the side of the road and doing a DUI. What is that? To try to shame or humiliate. If you have genuine serious questions to ask, tell him the question, let him answer them, and then ask a follow-up question. That's journalism.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Jesse, they wanted him on because they assume he would slam Trump. It didn't really matter, right? I mean, that was the. if (window && window.foxstrike && Array.isArray(window.foxstrike.cmd)) { window.foxstrike.cmd.push(function(Strike) { Strike.insertAd('desktop', 'lb20', 'desktop-desk-ad-lb20', ''); }); } else { console.error('Error: window.foxstrike not found'); }

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yeah, I mean, listen, Trump hires the best people.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: And we also know -- remember what the full Ginsberg is, you go on five shows. This is the full Nunberg. You go on five shows drunk. And listen, I don't blame CNN, actually, or MSNBC because this guy just gotten subpoenaed and it's kind of a big story. And I'd get drunk if I got subpoenaed by Mueller too. I get that.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: They're slamming it a little bit. It's sleazy. Cable news is sleazy sometimes. If it bleeds, it leads. This guy was a wounded animal, put them on. There's 24 hours to fill. What I don't like is the network news what they did. They went down into the gutter and took this guy when he said in the afternoon, and by 6:30 he was completely discredited. And they took it on and they made that the lead. Even though the guy contradicted himself and discredited himself so egregiously. He said Trump colluded, then he didn't collude. Said Carter Page colluded. Then he never met Carter Page. The guy was all over the map. He said he invented the wall and the travel ban was his idea. I mean, come on. The guy was clearly intoxicated. And the networks ran with it like it was serious stuff. That's what I don't like.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I think with Charles Gasparino. You guys see this -- he said that he talk to him, right? Said he might have been drinking. Not Charles.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Sam. if (window && window.foxstrike && Array.isArray(window.foxstrike.cmd)) { window.foxstrike.cmd.push(function(Strike) { Strike.insertAd('desktop', 'lb21', 'desktop-desk-ad-lb21', ''); }); } else { console.error('Error: window.foxstrike not found'); }

utterances.sentences: Sam. Juan, you're not drinking right now, are you, Juan?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Democrats hoping a blue wave can take down Ted Cruz today in Texas, as the midterm election season officially begins. That's next.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: The 2018 midterm election season, officially, underway. Texas holding the first of the nation's primary today. Democrats are trying to turn a red state blue. They're turning out in force. Could it be a hint of what's to come for Republicans in November? Senator Ted Cruz is up for reelection and he's sending a challenge from Democrat, Beto O'Rourke, who's been raking a lot of campaign cash.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yeah. I think the turnout is driven by one thing, the desire to undo a previous election. If you can get new senators and new congressman in there, you can get impeachment because you can't win on the issues, because you've got the two big issues, economy and foreign policy right now, and Trump is doing an excellent job. The only way you can get rid of the guy is by electing more people who can get rid of him. That's the way I see it and I'm sticking to it.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: All right. So Jesse, you had a situation there in Texas, and this is whether or not, you know, Texas might be a harbinger of things to come. Every seat, every one of the 36 congressional seats in Texas now has a Democrat challenging for it. We haven't seen this.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes. The Texas Democrats are getting very organized. There's a lot of people from blue states that are moving to Texas for tax purposes. There's a lot of young Americans going to college in Texas. A growing Hispanic population. And I don't think they're going to turn it blue. I think that's a pipe dream. It's not even purple yet. Trump won it by nine. But I think Ted Cruz has a competitive race. He'll keep the seat. But the national party is going to have to spend a lot of extra money to make sure he secures that. And that's going to take money away from other more competitive senate seats where they're looking to, you know, get rid of the Democratic incumbent.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: And Kimberly, we're a week away from a primary -- or a special election, I should say, in the state of Pennsylvania.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Yeah.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: You've got Rick -- I think it's Saccone, who is the Republican, versus Conor Lamb who is the Democrat. Saccone a strong evangelical conservatives. Lamb is a former marine, former prosecutor like you. What do you see there?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Look, obviously, an upset there would be very bad in a place that's, you know, Trump friendly; would be a blow to the White House, especially during this time that timing is not fortuitous. You know, to have a setback and suffer a loss there. So I think it's important that they deliver and make sure that there is a positive, you know, outcome. I think that's going to also be a little bit of a litmus test and kind of Republicans, GOP going to be watching that closely to see what happens. And then, as it relates to Texas, I'll just offer my own answer for that, unsolicited. I think that Ted Cruz is going to win reelection. I'm just saying -- this is what I think from just studying it. But nevertheless, can't put it in for sure. But never -- he's the type of guy -- remember, he's "Green Eggs and Ham." He will do whatever it takes and work 24 hours to make sure that he wins reelection. I wouldn't, you know, ever count him out.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: So Dana, you have a situation in Pennsylvania where people are saying, well, could it be that President Trump, who won the 18th District, I think, by 30-plus points, has decided to start talking about tariffs, because it might appeal to some of these steelworkers, union folks in the district, and therefore help the Republicans?

utterances.speaker: DANA PERINO, CO-HOST
utterances.sentences: Well, I had Rick Saccone on the show the other day, and he did say he absolutely supports that. Although it is -- there are a lot of union members in the district, and that happened to be the same week that the Supreme Court heard arguments about whether or not a union should be allowed to demand money from union members in order to then spend it on political activities, even if they don't agree with those political activities. And then it was a little bit like, "Well, I'm not exactly sure." Because it's a tough district. The Democrats trying to win Texas reminds me of Republicans who said for years they could won Pennsylvania, and then Trump won Pennsylvania.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: And I think that -- I don't think that Ted Cruz will lose. I do think that Democrats will pick up some of the local and state races, and that's how you build back a movement. Remember, they were decimated in the Obama years. So they are having a chance to really make their way back. The other thing I would point out is on turnout, in Virginia's gubernatorial election last November, Ed Gillespie got more Republicans than ever in the history of that state to come out and vote for him, and he still lost by nine points. So turnout is key.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: I think it is, but I disagree with you guys. I think this is going to be a nip-and-tuck race for Senator Cruz, in large part because Democrats are so energized, and it's not the case on the Republican side right now now. Some Democrats in Congress under fire for ties to blatant racist and anti- Semite Louis Farrakhan. That's straight ahead.

utterances.speaker: JESSE WATTERS, CO-HOST
utterances.sentences: Welcome back to "The Five." FOX News has just confirmed that President Trump's top economic advisor, Gary Cohn, has just resigned. President Trump said this: "Gary has been my chief economic advisor and did a superb job in driving our agenda, helping to deliver historic tax cuts and reforms, and unleashing the American economy once again. He's a rare talent, and I thank him for his dedicated service to the American people." And this statement out from Mr. Cohn: "It has been an honor to serve my country and enact pro-growth economic policies to benefit the American people, in particular, the passage of historic tax reform. I'm grateful to the president for giving me this opportunity and wish him and the administration great success in the future." All right. Kimberly, he came from Goldman Sachs.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Correct.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: And great pedigree there. Very successful on Wall Street. And he was considered what people say in the White House who didn't like him, a globalist. Meaning not an American nationalist, more concerned about the world economy and not necessarily a defender of the American manufacturing base. And had a lot of internal fights with some members of the administration. And some people are now speculating that he may have resigned in the wake of President Trump's saying that he's going to enact steel tariffs. What do you think?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: OK. So I think that he's obviously a highly competent individual. He was well-regarded at Goldman Sachs. I say it's fair to say that people thought that he was more of a globalist. That term has been used. I think that he's somebody, obviously, that wanted to serve the country. He worked very hard in there. The president liked his organization. And he would present, like, charts with him, and like different color-coded, and he liked that. So he was very organized. I like organization. Dana Perino likes organization.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Indeed.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: So that, I think, is very good. If he felt that, you know, he had kind of provided the opportunities and the help and the assistance to the president and to the country, and his work was done there, that's one thing. I mean, the president made a tweet this morning, put out a tweet that said there may be some staff changes and things coming in the future. I think this is one that was expected. There's been discussion about Cohn, McMasters, and chief of staff John Kelly. So you have one of those people already now leaving, you know, the president. I'll also note that, you know, he's always been very close with Jared and Ivanka, as well. And that was kind of like a triumvirate right there, that the three of them were together and probably coalesced on some, you know, of the issues. He wasn't a big fan, proponent of exiting the Paris Climate Change Accord, so that was also probably part of the reason why people would, you know, frame him in that fashion as a globalist. But he certainly knows the economy, and he was very helpful, I think, to the president, you know, in that regard. And now you see, they'll bring in some -- some new people. Because what does President Trump do?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Always hires the best people.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: (LAUGHS)

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: What's so funny, Juan?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: That's hilarious.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: You haven't been hired.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Oh, my God. Jesse.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: I ain't looking for a job at the moment. I mean, that's ridiculous. But I mean, how many people come and go in this -- and they come and go so quickly. I mean, to me, what Kimberly said about Kushner is right forefront now, because he was seen as part of the Kushner wing of the Trump White House. And Kushner, obviously, is on very thin ice, having his security clearance downgraded. Can't really function properly in this White House. And charges of nepotism larger than ever. "Wall Street Journal" telling him, "Go back home."

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Well, I think he'll probably move to the campaign side.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Well, whatever.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: The president already announced his campaign. And then Ivanka will stay.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: But I'm saying that seeing Gary Cohn -- Gary Cohn is so widely respected on the economic side, now out. It just says to me boy, you know, we say, "Oh, downplay the chaos. Oh, it's not so bad." It is chaotic in there.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Markets might not like this.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: yes, but I think -- here's one thing. I think that he's been a loyal public servant and that when you said that a globalist cares more about the global economy than the American economy, I think he would say that that's not true. I think that what -- he's resigning on principle, because he cares about the American economy. And the accomplishments of this past year, especially with tax reform and the dereg piece, actually very much helped the United States economy. And just on principle, decided to resign. And that's when you know you have a loyal public servant. If you feel that you have given your best advice.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Well, like, guess what? Sorry. But you are the -- the president is the president. I'm only her. I can give you my best advice, and if you don't take my advice, if I feel strongly enough that it is a bad decision, then I should resign. And I think that we should welcome that. It doesn't always happen that way in Washington.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: And he had a good run, Greg, on the economic side.

utterances.speaker: GREG GUTFELD, CO-HOST
utterances.sentences: That he did. That he did. A typical globalist would say that, Dana. But no, the point is I -- I mean, if you want -- no, the point is, if you want cheap goods, to -- or goods that people can afford, and you want to spread the wealth, if that makes you a globalist, then you're a globalist. I'm so tired of that phrase.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Me, too.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I think the phrase has been -- it's become some kind of knee-jerk thing to say what Trump isn't. But the fact is, we're all globalists. We all are.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Like we're all dreamers?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: We're all dream -- we're all globalist dreamers. But the thing is, this really is about, I think, protectionism. And I think, you know, he was a big proponent of free trade, obviously, Cohn was. And the problem with populism, one day you zig, the next day you zag. You know, it depends on what's popular, what -- you know, what people like. And I think, you know, when you know, Trump will say he's a free marketer, but then he will talk about protectionism. Then he'll say, "Well, I'm about fair trade." And I think Cohn was hoping -- he knew this was going to come up. But he was hoping it wasn't going to come up this quickly.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: They're going to have a meeting tomorrow with --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: -- with consumers of steel products to try to change the president's mind, and that could be canceled.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Wasn't going to happen.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: And one of the realities of last week was that he was supposed to have the ability to review and talk to the president before the decision. The president just did it.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: We've got to get -- listen, enough of the White House drama. There's even more drama on TV.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: "The Bachelor."

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Hard news.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Breakup seen around the world. A guy dumped his fiancee on national TV. Everyone went crazy. K.G. is going to take this one.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: It's time now for an all new edition of "Kimberly's Dating Tips." No one can say I mail it in. That was all the way, baby. All right. Some very important advice today: How not to break up with your fiancee. Now, whatever you do, don't do it on national television. And another tip: Don't propose in the first place if you're in love with someone else. How about that? Well, I present to you last night's disastrous "Bachelor" finale. ARIE LUYENDYK JR., "THE BACHELOR": I -- I wanted it so bad for us, but there was something that was holding me back. And I just -- I can't go through with it. I love you so much. BECCA KUFRIN, "THE BACHELOR" CONTESTANT: I love you.

utterances.speaker: LUYENDYK
utterances.sentences: Becca, will you marry me?

utterances.speaker: KUFRIN
utterances.sentences: Of course. So what? Do you want to be back with her?

utterances.speaker: LUYENDYK
utterances.sentences: I want to see if there's that possibility.

utterances.speaker: KUFRIN
utterances.sentences: Are you (EXPLETIVE DELETED) kidding me?

utterances.speaker: LUYENDYK
utterances.sentences: Are you OK?

utterances.speaker: KUFRIN
utterances.sentences: Leave. What are you still doing here?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Oh, the worst! OK. Arie Luyendyk ripping Becca's heart out after blindsiding her with the news that he wants runner-up Lauren instead. Well, ABC is also under fire for televising the breakup. I mean, what is going on around here? Look at Greg. He is delighted. He's, like, "The Bachelor's" biggest fan.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Well, for one thing, the brunette, you dodged a bullet. There isn't a bigger loser than that dude.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: When he enters a room, the median I.Q. of a group drops 5 percent. He is the dumbest man on television. And you know what sucks about this? The only reason why he broke up with her was he was -- to go back with the blonde that he dumped before. He had to check with her first and see that she would take him back. Because he wanted a backup wife. He was afraid --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Gross.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: If she -- if the blonde didn't agree to go back with him, he wouldn't have broken up with this girl. Because he's such a coward and a wuss and a wimp. You know this guy what this guy is? He's a guy --

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: A coward, a wuss and a wimp.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: He's a cad. He's what you call a cad. A cad gets everything in life, so they don't want to actually make choices about life. They don't want to -- like, they don't want to make a decision about what -- like, they'd rather string people along.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: You can tell by the tilt of his -- yes, you can tell by the tilt of his head.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I can't stand his voice. He's the -- he's just so annoying. That's why I watched the show, just to hate-watch Arie-head. I call him Arie-head. His name's Arie.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Wait a second. You just said that's why you watch the show?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I watched it just to throw things at that guy.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: OK, going very negatory for "Kimberly's Dating Tips."

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: He's an unsuitable suitor.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: All right. Dana.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Well, OK, but if you're Lauren, wouldn't it be best if tonight you dumped him back?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: But she won't.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: She won't?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: NO, because he never would've done the other thing. This is all planned.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Right. Greg has been, like, heavy on the online "Bachelor" forums.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: This is a terrible way to try to find a life partner, America. Looks like that's dating tip number --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: This is a career for people.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Dana's advice is go in the friendly skies.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: That's right.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Go in the friendly skies and find a husband up there. OK, Jesse, do you know anything about this whatsoever? And I'm a little bit concerned about the similar hairstyle.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: My gosh.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Arie's hair was my color in the beginning of the season. Then look at it. I'm just surprised a relationship on "The Bachelor" didn't work out. I mean, they always work out so perfectly. I've watched every season of "The Bachelor" except this one. And I actually missed the most dramatic season. This was the most dramatic season.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: They say that every year.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: This guy was a tool. He never should've been cast as the main guy.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I don't know why they did. But I'm going to tune in tonight. I'm going to DVR "Hannity."

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Oh, my gosh. Oh, my goodness. OK, so Juan, what do you think of this, like, fiasco?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Will Jesse marry Hannity? I don't know, because I think --

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Trump picks the best people.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: That's true. But Tucker may get -- come back from vacation after this. I don't know. I've got to say, I've never watched a minute of it. I think it is tawdry. I'm so sorry if he hurt that young woman's feelings.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Because that's a pretty serious thing to do. And the idea that you televised it, well, I guess that's what this is, is reality TV. We want to see someone in pain and weeping. But boy, I tell you, I think you could go read a book.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: What would you have done to him, K.G.?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Yes. See, I happen to have my handy pen ready and --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: That's true.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: -- before he could get a word out, you just -- (PLUNGES PEN INTO HER NECK) I just want to save America.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: That -- he deserves some kind of punishment that he got away with.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: He's going to get that tonight.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: I think that's -- yes, that's coming.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: You think he's going to get punished?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: If the whole crowd hates him and both girls, I'm not so sure happy. And the host hates him.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: It's going to be a bloodbath tonight. It's going to be like Nunberg all over again.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: But make sure you watch "Hannity."

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: The producers, this is a dream for them.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: This is a great show.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: ABC is loving it. Everybody's going to watch it. He's, like, kind of the villain that everybody now is going to love to hate.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: And she's the hero. Becca will be the hero.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: And he's going to be on, like, "Dancing with the Stars" next or something.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: So what if someone did this to you?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Impossible. OK. "One More Thing" is up next.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: It's time now for "One More Thing" -- Jesse.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Well, if you love America, you're going to like my "One More Thing." It's about a bald eagle. Check out this footage in Montana. Guy captured some -- whoa, did you guys see that? So that's a closeup shot of a bald eagle swooping down and scooping up its prey. Oh, look at that. God, I love this country. And I'm going to be on "Hannity" tonight at 9 o'clock.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: That's why you wanted to watch it.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: You didn't get that?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: DVR "The Bachelor" and watch "Hannity" live.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes. You and the other Jesse?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes. Jess and Jess.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Oh my gosh.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Carlisle.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: That's right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Kimberly.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Come on, now. "Kimberly's Food Court." Perfect. Lots of animation today, folks. So everyone is excited about this, because it's Oreos, baby. And this is National Oreo Day. Why are there all this weird -- OK. OK, so Jesse is going to partake in this. He loves Oreos. So in honor of this momentous occasion, Oreo is giving away a million free Oreo chocolate candy bars today.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Eww!

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: I don't have one, but whatever. The first one million people who sign up on their website will get this. Don't "eww" it, Greg.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Candy bar? Oreo candy bar? No.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: This was created in 1912 by the National Biscuit Company, Nabisco. Yum, yum, you. And by the way, in Chelsea Market in Manhattan. How about that?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: That's right. I did hear about that.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Five hundred billion Oreos have been sold.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Where they used to tape "Oz."

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Do you prefer double stuff?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Do you pull it across like this?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes and then lick it off. There you go.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Talk about love.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: All right. That was Kimberly. Juan is next. WILLIAMS; All right. So you might have seen this image last week. It went viral in every way. That's 2-year-old Parker Curry staring at former first lady's Michelle Obama official portrait at the National Portrait Gallery in D.C. Michelle Obama so taken with this picture she invited the young woman to her office for a meeting, and that's when a dance party broke out.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: That little girl didn't know that Michelle Obama had been first lady. Her Mom said she thought she was looking at a queen. Little Miss Curry looked like a queen herself as she danced to "Shake It Off."

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: She is the cutest, cutest, cutest. Look at that. I love it.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Isn't that fun when you can make -- bring joy to a child?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: All right. Let's get to my important "One More Thing." I am the cutest! Let's do this.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Shake it off.

utterances.speaker: GRAPHIC
utterances.sentences: Greg's I Have a Lot of Free Time to Do Stuff News.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: "Greg's I Have a Lot of Free Time to Do Stuff News."

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: No kidding.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: This is where I focus on somebody with a lot of free time to do stuff. Like this guy. He's the host of "Action Lab." Take a look at what he did. He was able to build a perfect circle out of Pringles without using any glue at all, just employing the basic physics --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: -- which is the science of stacking that he loves. And that's what he's doing. He's --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: You said you had the best "One More Thing," and I -- I would have to agree.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: That is pretty amazing.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: What?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: You don't like the American eagle?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: What about my Oreo segment.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: The American eagle could fly into the Pringles ringle, they call it. Pringle ringle, as it's called. But that's from "The Action Lab."

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Do you have anything else today for "One More Thing"?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Is yours really that bad? You're, like, trying to stretch it out. Is it about Bill Hemmer.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Stall tactic.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: So you know there's going to be a storm tonight. Right? A little nor'easter. Well, we're not the only ones trying to stay warm. Check out this creativity in New York. Somebody decided to crochet some sweaters for the trees.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Wow.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: In case they get cold. And so the --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: That's crazy.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: The city was going to take them all down, because it's a violation.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: And it is.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: But guess what? The business owners came outside and said this helps bring customers. And so if you want to decorate a tree, you can do it, but you have to get a tree work permit.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: The tree doesn't have a choice in this. That's tree-ist.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: That is tree-ist.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: But you know what? You guys are all down on De Blasio. He said yes. Let the business community have this --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Let there be tree sweaters.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: He's one of -- one of them. He's a tree.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: All right. Set your DVRs. Never miss an episode of "The Sp [SIC] -- The Five." "Special Report" is up next. Content and Programming Copyright 2018 Fox News Network, LLC.
